official_title: A bill to provide that certain amounts of the revenues received by the United States under leases on the Outer Continental Shelf shall be used to acquire petroleum products for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
short_title: Strategic Petroleum Reserve Funding Act of 1983

summary.text: Strategic Petroleum Reserve Funding Act of 1983 - Amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to provide that specified revenues from leases on the Outer Continental Shelf shall be deposited in the Treasury as follows: (1) 80 percent shall be deposited in the Strategic Petroleum Reserve Account; and (2) the other 20 percent of such revenues shall be deposited in the miscellaneous receipts account. Permits the President, with the prior approval of Congress, to suspend or reduce such deposits if it would be in the national interest. Amends the Energy Policy and Conservation Act and the Land and Water Conservation Fund Act of 1965 to make conforming changes. Makes this Act effective for fiscal year 1984.

titles.title: Strategic Petroleum Reserve Funding Act of 1983

A bill to provide that certain amounts of the revenues received by the United States under leases on the Outer Continental Shelf shall be used to acquire petroleum products for the Strategic Petroleum Reserve.
